Description: Large vase of dull red pottery: mostly burnt black, and lacking the upper part. The vase has a flat base, from which the sides expand to the shoulder, then begin to converge towards the top. Within the vase are the burnt remains of the original contents. Close to the broken upper edge there is an incised mark of circular shape.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: W. M. F. Petrie, 'Abydos' I (London, 1902), 6, pl. VIII, 3; W. M. F. Petrie, 'Royal Tombs of the Earliest Dynasties' II, 9,46.
Acquisition name: Donated by: Egypt Exploration Fund (Commitee of)
